RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Claiming Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwi se Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERPETUAL PRAISE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand three then two wide until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, drew clear under a drive to prevail. STRANGE FRUIT coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one, kept on to secure the place honors. POWER AND GLORY stumbled at the start, chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened. UKRAINIAN PRINCESS three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, tired. SPATIAL REALITY coaxed from the start, chased three to four wide down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn, came under coaxing three furlongs from home, swung four wide into upper stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Strange Fruit
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed ins 3/8,3w uppr, no match, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Ukrainian Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Spatial Reality
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 2p 3/8, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Perpetual Praise
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 3-2w, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Power and Glory
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, 4-5w backstretch, 3w turn, 5w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1 3/8M Inner turf CR: 92. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 35 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EVER SUMMER bumped with a rival at the start and was off step slow, came under vigorous restraint early, traveled inside to the two path while tugging very hard at bit and held together under stout restraint, bobbled some down the backstretch, was let out when an opponent made an early move inside the half-mile pole, ranged up to the front with three furlongs to run, inched clear while set down into upper stretch, responded well under a strong hand-ride to the finish and prevailed. ANATOLIAN settled on the inside, stumbled inside the three-quarter pole, moved off the rail on the far turn, chased the winner willingly in the stretch, gained gradually on that foe late but missed while able to get the place. LULLABY LAND bumped with a foe at the start and was off a step slow then dropped back, saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear under some restraint, was removed from cover near the half-mile pole then advanced quickly to make an early move, made a bid in the four path going around the far turn, pursued the winner on the outside in the drive and finished with good courage but missed the place while clear for the show. RHEAUME was taken under a tight hold early then rated on the outside in the two to three path, came under urging on the far turn, chased under a drive into the stretch and came up empty. UNION DOLLY quickly went clear then dropped in while taken in hand, showed the way on the inside, was swallowed up with three furlongs to run and stopped then was eased in the stretch but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Anatolian
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,stumbled 5-1/2,ins-2p2nd turn,chased,gained,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Ever Summer
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,tight hold,pulled hard,ins-2p,let out7/16,lead2p3/8,held

ENTRY.NAME: Lullaby Land
ENTRY.OWNER: Abrams Ronald B and Abrams Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,drp bck,ins1st,at rear,mvd out1/2,gain,4w2nd,chsd,willing

ENTRY.NAME: Union Dolly
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Lion Thoroughbreds Iapetus Racing Brown Road Racing Diamond T Racing and Ha
ENTRY.COMMENT: quickly clr,mvd in,ins pace in hand,headed3/8,stopped,easd,wlkd

ENTRY.NAME: Rheaume
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,rated outside 2-3path,ask2nd turn,came up empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 83. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE CAUGHT MY EYE established the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside down the backstretch facing some pressure from TOWERING GAZE to the outside through moderate splits, tucked inside into the turn, came under coaxing with five-sixteenths to go and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive under threat to the outside, drifted out through the final sixteenth while gamely holding sway to the prevail at the end. SA FORADADA coaxed from the start, chased three then two wide down the backstretch before tucking inside with nine-sixteenths to go, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and tipped out four wide into upper stretch, rallied to loom boldly outside the aforementioned foe through the final furlong shying out slightly as that rival drifted but was ultimately repelled to the finish. TOWERING GAZE prompted the pace loosely between foes three then two wide, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and tired. GAGLIANO got away to an awkward beginning when brushing the near side stall in a lunging action forcing the rider to pull on the bit, chased along the inside sluggish early quickly growing detached from the main body of the field while taking up the rear, continued along the inside through the turn and went five to six wide into upper stretch well behind and was eased home to the wire. DOLCE SERA four then three wide in aim of the front outside the top pair, began to back away nearing the quarter pole when bumped solidly by CHAYSENBRYN when that rival suffered an injury, got altered out into upper stretch getting brought to a canter a furlong out before being pulled up with a sixteenth to go, then had the rider dismount and walk her the rest of the way to the finish before being examined by veterinarian and walked off under her own power. CHAYSENBRYN chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, suffered an injury to the right front nearing the quarter pole bumping with DOLCE SERA just prior to being expertly pulled up by the rider and had to be euthanized on track.

ENTRY.NAME: Gagliano
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, sluggish, chased ins, 5-6w upper, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Sa Foradada
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, ins turn, tip 4w upper, loomed, repelled

ENTRY.NAME: She Caught My Eye
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, drifted, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Chaysenbryn
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, suffered injury near 1/4, euthanized

ENTRY.NAME: Towering Gaze
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, angled 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Dolce Sera
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w in aim, bumped near 1/4, altered out, pulled up, walked off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 7F Turf CR: 83. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DREAMPOINT settled off the pace, was roused between foes while two then three wide on the turn, rallied outside to get the lead in upper stretch, responded well under threat from the runner-up into the final sixteenth, drifted out under a left-handed crop while fending off the runner-up late and held sway. CAPTAIN PARTY settled towards the rear, raced inside early on the turn, was held-up behind horses at the three-eighths, moved forward while shifting to the two path late on that bend, spun three wide into the stretch then tipped further out while rallying, chased the winner on the outside into the final sixteenth, shied out off heels when that opponent drifted out late and was turned away while clear for the place. LT. MITCHELL was well placed just off the pace, drafted inside on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, steadied while blocked behind horses near the three-sixteenths, altered course towards the outside outside the furlong marker, pursued the winner into the final furlong and weakened. PRINCE OF TROY was last to commence then reserved under a tight hold, went four wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. SCREW LOOSE stalked the pace on the outside, was given his cue while three then two wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, dropped back under a drive into the final furlong and tired. HERONEANDONLY went to the front, showed the way while inside of a foe, moved to a solo lead near the half-mile pole, raced inside on the turn, was asked nearing the quarter-pole, lost the advantage under a drive in upper stretch and gave way. UNAFFECTED had his saddle adjusted behind the gate, dropped back on the outside, angled in late on the backstretch, saved ground on the turn and failed to threaten. ONE FOR MY BROTHER settled just off the pace on the outside, was asked three wide on the turn, dropped back passing the five-sixteenths and came up empty. FOLLOWING A JOCKEY CLAIM OF FOUL BY THE RIDER OF CAPTAIN PARTY ALLEGING INTERFERENCE AGAINST DREAMPOINT IN THE FINAL SIXTEENTH. THE STEWARDS' MADE NO CHANGE TO THE ORDER OF FINISH. THREE QUARTER FRACTION WAS HAND-TIMED DUE TO A TIMING ISSUE.

ENTRY.NAME: Lt. Mitchell
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,inside turn,ask1/4,blckd3/16,stdy,alter out,chsd,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: settld,ins-2p,held up3/8,3w1/4,4w3/16,chsd,off heels late,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Dreampoint
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,asked 2-3p btwn foes turn,lead3/16,drift out late,held

ENTRY.NAME: Prince of Troy
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,reserved,tight hold,4w turn,5w1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Heroneandonly
ENTRY.OWNER: Simeone Paul J Joyce Kevin DeVaney Randall and Cartier Cohen
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,pace inside foe,rail turn,ask1/4,headed3/16,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Screw Loose
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,asked 3-2path turn,even terms 3/16,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: One for My Brother
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,outside,asked 3w turn,drop back 5/16,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Unaffected
ENTRY.COMMENT: saddle adjusted behind gate,drop back,mvd in,rail turn,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 37000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherw ise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BERT BERT BERT brushed the off side stall when breaking out at the start and bumped and squeezed back PAPI ON ICE in tandem with STRONG LIGHT, conceded three to four lengths to the front and chased three wide, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, tipped three to four wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong from home, edged away under a drive to prevail. OUR SON JAKE prompted the leader from the outside in the four path before advancing on that rival in tandem with STRONG LIGHT with nine-sixteenths to go, took over command tucking to the two path nearing the half mile pole and showed the way through the turn patiently handled until set down spinning four wide into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was collared a furlong out, kept on clear of the rest to preserve the place honors. STRONG LIGHT bobbled at the start recovering inwards to bump and squeeze back PAPI ON ICE in concert with BERT BERT BERT, chased four then three wide advancing on the top pair suddenly with nine-sixteenths to go, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths and swung four wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid a furlong out, couldn't sustain the move and flattened out in the late stages. SCOTTO four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, stayed on one paced through to the finish. PAPI ON ICE got bumped between foes who each broke his way and was squeezed back at the start conceding about five lengths to the front, chased three paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild late bid. GOING IN STYLE chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and tired. SORPRESO showed brief speed from the three path down the backstretch under prompting to the outside, tucked inside with nine-sixteenths to go under threat from a pair and yielded near the half mile pole, got coaxed along fading through the turn along the inside, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and folded.

ENTRY.NAME: Sorpreso
ENTRY.COMMENT: cut pace 3p, to ins 9/16, yielded 1/2, faded, ins 1/4, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Going in Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, angled 5-6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bert Bert Bert
ENTRY.OWNER: Lambe Robert and Cox William J
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w uppr, up 1/8, edged away

ENTRY.NAME: Papi On Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump betw, squeezed st, 3w early, ins turn, 3w uppr, late bid

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, chased 4-3w, bid 9/16, 4w upper, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Scotto
ENTRY.OWNER: Cipriano Vito Scotti Neil Alfleri Anthony and Bochilo Vincent
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Our Son Jake
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 4p, up 2p 1/2, 4w upper, collared 1/8, kept on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 35 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LA CONQUISTADORA bumped with a rival at the start, went to the front, was well rated while setting the pace on the inside, responded well when asked near the quarter-pole, fought off multiple challengers in the stretch and held gamely under strong urging. BOMB SQUAD went three wide on the first turn, was rated just off the pace under a tight hold, saved ground on the far turn, came under a drive in upper stretch, chased the winner into the final furlong, gained in the two path into the final sixteenth and finished willingly to just get the place. THE SPLENDID ONE broke out and bumped with a rival, saved ground while keen under snug restraint on the first turn, was rated off the pace, went three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch then moved further out, rallied outside into the final furlong, drifted in while gaining around the sixteenth-pole and finished with good energy to just miss the place while able to get the show. ARISAEMA bumped with a rival at the start, bumped with that same foe nearing the first turn, went three wide on that bend, was reserved off the pace, bumped with a rival near the nine-sixteenths, traveled three wide on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch, chased the winner in the drive and lacked the needed kick. DREAM ON CARA was bumped at the start, bumped with foes on both sides nearing the first turn, tugged on the bit under stout restraint while between foes in the two path going around that bend then was taken under a tighter hold while off heels, moved in near the three-quarter pole, saved ground on the far turn, angled out in upper stretch and improved position. SILENT MELODY was a bit slow into stride, bumped with a rival nearing the first turn, saved ground while rank on that bend then checked off heels, was reserved towards the rear, moved from the rail to the two path on the final turn, was asked for her best in upper stretch and failed to rally. SHE'S A NATURAL was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, went five wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside without cover, rounded the far turn in the four path while let out, came under a drive while in striking range in upper stretch but lacked the needed response. SPERSS bumped with a foe just after the start, went two to three wide on the first turn, was rated off the pace, moved out and bumped with a foe near the nine-sixteenths, was asked in the two path on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch and also lacked the needed kick. PINSTRIPEPIZZO bumped with a rival just after the start then was taken in hand, tugged on the bit while eager in the four path on the first turn, dragged her way forward entering the backstretch then stalked on the outside, issued a challenge near the seven-sixteenths, vied in the two path on the far turn, dropped back into the final furlong and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: Silent Melody
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable Maspeth Stables and Dark Horse Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit slow into stride,bmpd early,rank,checked,ins-2p,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: The Splendid One
ENTRY.OWNER: Brodsky Alan and Hennig Mark A
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,keen rail 1st,rated,3w2nd,4w1/4,mvd out,good energy

ENTRY.NAME: Dream On Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,bmpd btwn early,keen 2p,resrvd,ins2nd,angled,improved

ENTRY.NAME: La Conquistadora
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,to front,well rated ins,asked 1/4,responded,gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Arisaema
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,bmpd early,3w1st,rated,bmpd4-1/2,3w2nd,outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Sperss
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,2-3p1st,rated,ask 2p2nd turn,3p1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Pinstripepizzo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,in hand,4w1st,pulled,stlkd outside,2p2nd,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Bomb Squad
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,tight hold,just off pace,ins2nd,ask1/4,chsd,2p3/16,willing

ENTRY.NAME: She's a Natural
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,5w1st,reserved outside,4w2nd,striking range,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferre d)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUSTIN BAY established the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and spun three wide into upper stretch, went clear under a drive and was geared down through the final sixteenth to the finish. CINDERELLA'S CAUSE four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three to four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one and was able to hold for the place honors on the wire. MY FIRST LOVE four wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and kept on to secure the show honors. MIA BEA STAR got bumped at the start lightly by SISTER LINDA, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch and improved position to the finish. SISTER LINDA broke out coaxed from the start and bumped MIA BEA STAR lightly, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and weakened. RIBOT'S VALENTINE chased along the inside under coaxing from three furlongs out, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Ribot's Valentine
ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club and Blue Streak Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bustin Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, went clear, geared down

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Robert D. Rosenthal & Peter Rosenthal & Martin Greenberg

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Linda
ENTRY.OWNER: CWVII Stables LLC and Togabred Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mia Bea Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Reyana and Reya Racing and Rampersaud Totaram
ENTRY.COMMENT: lightly bumped st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: My First Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 5w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Cinderella's Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w backstretch, 3-4w turn, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, held 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 6F Turf CR: 102. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 105000. (UP TO $18,270 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winn ers Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Six Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MID DAY IMAGE bumped with a rival at the start, showed speed inside of two foes then was eased back off the pace, moved out while well placed behind the leading duo, stalked that pair while two then three wide on the turn, rallied to the lead in the five path into upper stretch then kicked clear, responded well in the final furlong and proved best under steady urging. HEAVEN STREET made light contact with an opponent at the start, settled off the pace, was roused in the two path on the turn, shifted four wide outside the quarter-pole, turned into upper stretch under a drive, chased the winner to the finish and earned the place. GUN IT bumped lightly with a foe at the start, settled off the pace, was roused while two to three wide on the turn, advanced into a reasonable striking position before the quarter-pole, moved out outside the furlong marker and lacked the needed kick while along for the show. SLIPSTREAM broke in then was corrected by the rider, dropped back on the outside early then angled to the rail, saved ground while asked on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, steadied behind horses approaching the furlong marker, hesitated while attempting to go between those foes inside the that marker, split horses outside the sixteenth-pole and missed the show. SOUPER SUCCESS bumped with a rival at the start, set the pace under pressure to his outside, vied along the rail on the turn, lost the lead late on that bend, dropped back under a drive in upper stretch and weakened. COMEDY TOWN pressed the pace on the outside, drew even with the leader near the seven-sixteenths, vied in the two path on the turn, took a short lead late on that bend, lost the advantage to the winner into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Mid Day Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Winning Move Stable, Sanford H. Robbins LLC and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,eased back,mvd out,rated,2-3p turn,lead 5p3/16,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Souper Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,set pressured pace,ins turn,headed outside1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Comedy Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed outside,even 7/16,2path turn,led passing1/4,headed,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Gun It
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,settled,gain 2-3p turn,mvd out 1/8,along for show

ENTRY.NAME: Heaven Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,settled,roused 2p turn,4p outside1/4,up for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Slipstream
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,dropped back,mvd in,ins turn,stdy1/8,split foes,miss3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 79. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred ). (Rail at 35 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE HEADLIGHT three wide into the first turn, tucked to the two path through that bend before tipping back out three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path into the far turn, came under coaxing angling three wide at the five-sixteenths, angled out six wide into upper stretch and offered up a good finish to close outside of rivals to take command seventy yards from home then inched away to the end. SLAPINTHEFACE just off the inside tracking the front from mid pack, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and rallied with good energy to be in the midst of seizing command when ONE HEADLIGHT went on by to the outside and was along for the place honors on the wire. TONY O broke out at the start and was corrected, tracked the pace along the inside in aim of the front, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, cut the corner into upper stretch, tipped out to the two path with three-sixteenths to run and offered up a mild kick to just get up for the show honors in the final jumps. STOW ON THE WOLD established the front just after the start and showed the way in hand along the inside through sensible splits, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under threat and was caught in the final seventy yards to the finish. FERRIS MULER broke out at the start bumping VALENTINO'S HERE, saved ground near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just of the inside into upper stretch and improved position to the wire. VINCE THE PRINCE forwardly placed just off the inside tracking the leader in closest aim, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun two then three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the stretch. VALENTINO'S HERE got bumped at the start by FERRIS MULER, raced just off the inside through the first turn before chasing three to four wide down the backstretch, tucked three wide into the far turn bumping ZAPRUDER to the two path, went seven wide into upper stretch and was unable to make an impact. ZAPRUDER four wide into the first turn, tucked quickly to the two path and chased two to three wide, was briefly three wide heading to the far turn when bumped back to the two path by the aforementioned foe, angled six wide into upper stretch and came up empty. OVER THE CAP dwelt at the start getting away last and conceding six to seven lengths to the front, chased along the inside through the opening bend and then two to three wide down the backstretch and through the far turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide for home and made no impact. MUDVILLE NINE four then three wide into the first turn, tucked to the two path by midway, chased three wide down the backstretch and through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, went four to five wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Stow On the Wold
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed near 1/4, ins 1/4, dug in, caught fin 70yds

ENTRY.NAME: Over the Cap
